2a0be8d62ca9580cd38315202869a51a (02:58): snoyes: apparently this is a bug: 1 	Table names are stored in lowercase on disk and name comparisons are not case sensitive. MySQL converts all table names to lowercase on storage and lookup. This behavior also applies to database names as of MySQL 4.0.2, and to table aliases as of 4.1.1.

3d825ab736200154c06f95be2c1fdd8b (03:01): My approach would be to use some scripting language with a function to do that, like PHP's ucwords
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (03:01): your apache children are stuck waiting for mysql to unlock tables for writes
4d6fad18f5905dd3f0489d69385c7be8 (03:01): people reload the page, apache runs out of chidlren, and your site crashes
